metadata.Title: CVE-2018-14354 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in Mutt before 1.10.1 and NeoMutt before 2018-07-16. They allow remote IMAP servers to execute arbitrary commands via backquote characters, related to the mailboxes command associated with a manual subscription or unsubscription.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-14354` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

mutt - 1.9.4-3ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mutt package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.9.4-3ubuntu0.1').
neomutt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
